content.description:
On the backside of the Beginner's Slabs, just right of the mixed line,

Sir Mixed A Lot

lies a nice trad line that could be one of the best moderate cracks to lead at Hartmans. Also, it is easily toproped as some anchors were put in, courtesy of Chad Robinson in 2010.
content.location:
Find the flake crack of

Sir Mixed A Lot

, and Back Where It All Begins Â is just a few feet right. It follows a moderate crack system up to a two bolt anchor.

content.description:
On Beginner's Backside, this route is left of

107033661

, letter "A" in the photo. It follows the gully/chimney that goes upwards and right. There are some fun chimney sections worth trying. Good pro is present. Still, it is pretty chossy. There is possibly a loose boulder midway up. I used

Sir Mixed A Lot's

anchors to toprope my follower up, she then cleaned the anchor and rappelled (a bit tricky getting to the anchors for the follower - we climbed from behind to get to them).
content.location:
On Beginner's backside to the left of

Baby's Got Crack

, this is letter "A" in the photo. Find the gully that goes upwards and right. There are no bolts at the top. See the description.

content.description:
This is a fun route going up the obvious flake on the back of Beginner's Slab. There are two bolts on the flake where the crux is and then a big runout to the next bolt above the flake where it meets with

Sir Mix A Lot

. It felt about like 11d, but I am not totally sure.
content.location: Start right in the middle of the flake on Beginner's Slab, and follow the bolts straight up.

content.description: This is a fun, easy climb up a narrow gully/chimney.
content.protection: Set up a toprope from the 2-bolt anchor.
content.location:
This climb is between

Ferringy

(on the left) and

Cardassian

(on the right).

content.description: This is presumably a 40' crack. To be edited in.
On Beginner Slab's backside, start up an obvious, nice, layback crack that turns to hands. Then it goes up the face past two bolts, to the anchor. Keith Brett gets credit for the clever name.
content.protection: A few cams are necessary to protect the crack climbing section, which is about 20 feet.
content.location: Look for the big flake crack for the start on the backside of the Beginner's Slabs, aka the Beginner's Backside.

content.description:
Just left of '

Safety First

', you can TR the harder variation.
content.protection: A TR, otherwise there is none.
content.location:
It is just left of '

Safety First

' on the far left of the front side.

content.description: This is an excellent first lead and was bolted for beginner leaders with 8 bolts!
content.location: This route is not on the main front face but just to the left of it. You can easily access the anchor from a safe ledge by scrambling up like you are setting up a TR on the main face.

content.description:
It follows the crystal seam up the watergroove. In my opinion, it is slightly harder than

Devil's Spine

. Once again, it is a great beginner lead.
content.location: This is the third route from the left of the rock.

content.description: This is a fun, little, sport route that follows the quartz crystals on the left side of the rock.  This is a great beginner's climb with a good stance to set up the anchors at the top.
This a a fun, little, intermediate route; however, be careful at the start, because the rock can be a little crumbly in sections. After that, it is bomber.
content.protection: Three bolts to a two chain anchor.
content.location: This is the route to farthest right which starts on a mini-ledge.
